Any sugar level more than 200mg/dl in a diabetic child should be taken as high and acted upon.
Common causes are:
1. intake of sugar containing snacks/foods (after attending birth day/ marriage party). 
2. missing insulin dose. 

3. inter-current infections. 

4. stress (exams, menses etc). 

5. puberty. 

6. wrong assessment of insulin dosage. 

Symptoms
1. excessive thirst. 

2. frequent and night time urination 

3. excessive hunger 

4. weakness

Treatment of hyperglycemia
If blood sugar is more than 200mg/dl (150-180 for older children for tighter control) any time, extra dose of short acting insulin should be given (even if insulin dose is not due otherwise at that time). Extra dose required is 1 unit for each 50mg (100 mg for children less than 5 years) increase in blood sugar above 200mg/dl.
